net.sf.sprockets.view

Class Animators

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.sprockets.view.Animators

  • public class Animators
extends Object
    Utility methods for working with ViewPropertyAnimators.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static ViewPropertyAnimator makeScaleDownAnimation(Activity activity)
      Scale the Activity down to the rectangle provided by its getIntent().getSourceBounds().

      Scale the Activity down to the rectangle.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • makeScaleDownAnimation

        public static ViewPropertyAnimator makeScaleDownAnimation(Activity activity)
        Scale the Activity down to the rectangle provided by its getIntent().getSourceBounds(). To see the Activity behind this one, you must include the below attributes[1] in your Activity theme. You may further modify the animator, for example to fade out the Activity by decreasing its alpha and/or set an end action that finishes the Activity. When finishing the Activity in this way, you may wish to also call Activity.overridePendingTransition(0, 0) in order to prevent the system Activity close animation from running.

        1. Activity theme attributes 

        <item name="android:windowBackground">@android:color/transparent</item>
 <item name="android:windowIsTranslucent">true</item>

        Returns:
        null when the Activity's Intent does not have source bounds
        See Also:
        ActivityOptions.makeScaleUpAnimation(View, int, int, int, int)

      • makeScaleDownAnimation

        public static ViewPropertyAnimator makeScaleDownAnimation(Activity activity,
                                          Rect to)
        Scale the Activity down to the rectangle. To see the Activity behind this one, you must include the below attributes[1] in your Activity theme. You may further modify the animator, for example to fade out the Activity by decreasing its alpha and/or set an end action that finishes the Activity. When finishing the Activity in this way, you may wish to also call Activity.overridePendingTransition(0, 0) in order to prevent the system Activity close animation from running.

        1. Activity theme attributes 

        <item name="android:windowBackground">@android:color/transparent</item>
 <item name="android:windowIsTranslucent">true</item>

        See Also:
        ActivityOptions.makeScaleUpAnimation(View, int, int, int, int)
